executable.title: Separate Stains (PCA-based Macenko method)
executable.description: Sample the foreground of a slide to compute the stain vectors using the Macenko method.
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the HistomicsTK project.

image.name: sample_slide_path
image.label: Input Slide
image.description: Path to input slide image to be deconvolved

float.name: sample_sample_fraction
float.label: Sample Fraction
float.description: Fraction of pixels to sample. Specify either this or --sampleApproximateTotal

float.name: sample_magnification
float.label: Magnification
float.description: Desired magnification for sampling. The default value indicates native scan magnification.

float.name: sample_tissue_seg_mag
float.label: Segmentation Magnification
float.description: Low resolution magnification at which foreground and background will be segmented.

float.name: sample_min_coverage
float.label: Minimum Coverage
float.description: Minimum background coverage required for a tile to be sampled from.

integer.name: sample_sample_approximate_total
integer.label: Approximate sample total
integer.description: Use instead of sample_fraction to specify roughly how many pixels to sample. The fewer tiles are excluded, the more accurate this will be.

double.name: macenko_minimum_magnitude
double.label: Minimum magnitude
double.description: The magnitude below which vectors will be excluded from the computation of the angle distribution

double.name: macenko_min_angle_percentile
double.label: Minimum angle percentile
double.description: The smaller percentile of one of the vectors to pick from the angle distribution

double.name: macenko_max_angle_percentile
double.label: Maximum angle percentile
double.description: The larger percentile of one of the vectors to pick from the angle distribution

file.name: outputAnnotationFile
file.label: Output SDA colors of each stain

string.name: dask_scheduler
string.label: Scheduler Address
string.description: Address of a dask scheduler in the format '127.0.0.1:8786'. Not passing this parameter sets up a dask cluster on the local machine. 'multiprocessing' uses Python multiprocessing. 'multithreading' uses Python multiprocessing in threaded mode.

integer.name: sample_tile_grouping
integer.label: Tile grouping
integer.description: Number of tiles to process as part of a single task
